description.p: Monks of the way of Gravitation use their ki to manipulate the very force of gravity. To them it is a simple extension of their natural force.

sheet.description: Monks of the way of Gravitation use their ki to manipulate the very force of gravity. To them it is a simple extension of their natural force.

description.p: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level your blows are so heavy that they reform gravity around them. you gain the following benefits to your unarmed attacks:

Whenever you strike two different creatures with you unarmed attacks within five rounds of each other you can spend a ki point to create an attraction between the two. They must make a strength saving throw against your ki DC or be pulled towards each other at a rate of 10ft per round. When they collide they take a damage as if they had been falling towards each other

If you strike the same creature twice in the same round you can create a gravitational anchor. You can spend 1 ki point to create the anchor, for each 5ft the creature tries to move they must make a strength check against your ki DC. if they fail they loose all further movement on this turn.

description.p: At third level you can manipulate gravity around yourself, you can stand up from prone using 5ft of movement.
Additionally you can spend a ki point to increase you high jump by 10ft, your long jump by 15ft, or reduce falling damage by 1d10.

description.p: At 6th level you get the following abilities:
Catch You can spend a ki point as a reaction to cast feather fall on yourself without any components
Anchor As a reaction to being moved you can choose to increase gravity and not be moved instead

description.p: At 11th level when you use your step of the wind feature you gain flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of the round.
Additionally whenever you hit someone with your unarmed strike they take force damage equal to twice your wisdom modifier

description.p: At 17th level your abilities at manipulating gravity have grown to the point where you can control direction to an unprecedented degree. When you strike a creature you can spend a number of ki points to launch it in a direction you choose. The creature must make a strength save against your ki DC on a success they move half the distance on a fail they move the full distance. The distance they move is equivalent to 30ft X the number of ki points you spend.
